member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing
member.summary: Access information about the subscribed SKUs and the corresponding service plans. You can retrieve information such as the SKU Object ID, SKU ID, number of licenses assigned, the license state (enabled, suspended, or warning), and the SKU part number. For the corresponding service plans, you can retrieve the ID, the capability status, or the name.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.ResetSubscribedSKU:Boolean
member.summary: Sets the enumerator for the subscribed SKUs to its initial position, which is before the first subscribed SKU in the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully reset and otherwise false.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.NextSubscribedSKU:Boolean
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next subscribed SKU in the collection. If only known service plans should be included, it advances to the next SKU known in Business Central.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next SKU; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUCapabilityStatus:Text
member.summary: Gets the capability status of the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The capability status of the subscribed SKU, or an empty string if the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUConsumedUnits:Integer
member.summary: Gets the number of licenses assigned to the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The number of licenses that are assigned to the subscribed SKU, or 0 if the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUObjectId:Text
member.summary: Gets the object ID of the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The object ID of the current SKU. If the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized, it will return an empty string.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUPrepaidUnitsInEnabledState:Integer
member.summary: Gets the number of prepaid licenses that are enabled for the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The number of prepaid licenses that are enabled for the subscribed SKU. If the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized it will return 0.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUPrepaidUnitsInSuspendedState:Integer
member.summary: Gets the number of prepaid licenses that are suspended for the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The number of prepaid licenses that are suspended for the subscribed SKU. If the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized it will return 0.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUPrepaidUnitsInWarningState:Integer
member.summary: Gets the number of prepaid licenses that are in warning status for the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The number of prepaid licenses that are in warning status for the subscribed SKU. If the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized it will return 0.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUId:Text
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier (GUID) for the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection.
member.returns: The unique identifier (GUID) of the subscribed SKU; empty string if the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SubscribedSKUPartNumber:Text
member.summary: Gets the part number of the subscribed SKU that the enumerator is currently pointing to in the collection. For example, "AAD_PREMIUM" OR "RMSBASIC."
member.returns: The part number of the subscribed SKU or an empty string if the subscribed SKUs enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.ResetServicePlans
member.summary: Sets the enumerator for service plans to its initial position, which is before the first service plan in the collection.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.NextServicePlan:Boolean
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next service plan in the collection.
member.returns: True if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next service plan; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection or it was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.ServicePlanCapabilityStatus:Text
member.summary: Gets the service plan capability status.
member.returns: The capability status of the service plan, or an empty string if the service plan enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.ServicePlanId:Text
member.summary: Gets the service plan ID.
member.returns: The ID of the service plan, or an empty string if the service plan enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.ServicePlanName:Text
member.summary: Gets the service plan name.
member.returns: The name of the service plan, or an empty string if the service plan enumerator was not initialized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.IncludeUnknownPlans:Boolean
member.summary: Checks whether to include unknown plans when moving to the next subscribed SKU in the subscribed SKUs collection.
member.returns: True if the unknown service plans should be included. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Licensing.SetIncludeUnknownPlans(Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to include unknown plans when moving to the next subscribed SKU in subscribed SKUs collection.
member.param: The value to be set to the flag.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Tenant
member.summary: Exposes functionality to fetch attributes concerning the current tenant.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Tenant.GetAadTenantId:Text
member.summary: Gets the Microsoft Entra tenant ID.
member.returns: If the Entra tenant ID is a valid GUID, it will be returned in lowercase format and without brackets or parentheses (as per RFC4122 section 3), such as "f81d4fae-7dec-11d0-a765-00a0c91e6bf6". If it cannot be found, an empty string is returned.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Tenant.GetAadTenantDomainName:Text
member.summary: Gets the Microsoft Entra tenant domain name. If the Microsoft Graph API cannot be reached, the error is displayed.
member.returns: The Microsoft Entra tenant Domain Name.
member.error: Cannot retrieve the Microsoft Entra tenant domain name.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Tenant.GetCountryLetterCode:Code[2]
member.summary: Gets the current Microsoft Entra tenant registered country letter code. Visit Microsoft Admin Cententer to view or edit Organizational Information. If the Microsoft Graph API cannot be reached, the error is displayed.
member.returns: Country or region abbreviation for the organization in ISO 3166-2 format.
member.error: Cannot retrieve the Microsoft Entra tenant country letter code.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Tenant.GetPreferredLanguage:Code[2]
member.summary: Gets the current Microsoft Entra tenant registered preferred language. Visit Microsoft Admin Cententer to view or edit Organizational Information. If the Microsoft Graph API cannot be reached, the error is displayed.
member.returns: The preferred language for the organization. Should follow ISO 639-1 Code; for example, en.
member.error: Cannot retrieve the Microsoft Entra tenant preferred language.

member.remarks: Contact email corresponds to Mail property on the Graph user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD Graph User.GetPreferredLanguageID(DotNetTypeDeclaration::System#UserInfo):Integer
member.summary: Gets the preferred language ID of the provided Graph user.
member.remarks: Preferred language ID is derived from preferredLanguage property on the Graph user. If the preferred language is not set or it is set to a language that is not supported in Business Central, the function returns 0.
member.param: The Microsoft Entra user.
member.returns: The preferred language ID of the provided Graph user. Can be used to set the preferred language using the Language module.

member.remarks: The order in which the update is processed must be in the following order. Authentication email must be updated before Plan, and Plan must be updated before Language ID.

member.summary: Represents an update to the full name property of a user.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Identity#Azure AD User Update Entity.Plan
member.summary: Represents an update to the assigned plans for a user.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute
member.summary: Describes possible values for file attributes. For the list of possible values see: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/create-file#file-system-attributes

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.Read Only
member.summary: Indicates that the file is read-only.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.Hidden
member.summary: Indicates that the file is hidden, and thus is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.System
member.summary: Indicates that the file is used by the operating system.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.None
member.summary: Indicates that the there are no attributes.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.Archive
member.summary: Indicates that the file is an archive file. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.Temporary
member.summary: Indicates that the file is temporary. File systems attempt to keep all of the data in memory for quicker access rather than flushing the data back to mass storage. A temporary file should be deleted by the application as soon as it is no longer needed.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.Offline
member.summary: Indicates that the file is offline. The data of the file is not immediately available.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.Not Content Indexed
member.summary: Indicates that the file will not be indexed by the content indexing service.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Attribute.No Scrub Data
member.summary: Indicates that the file should not be read by background data integrity scanner.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Last Write Time
member.summary: Describes possible values for File Last Write Time header.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Last Write Time.Now
member.summary: The file last write time is set to the current time.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Last Write Time.Preserve
member.summary: The file last write time is preserved.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Permission Copy Mode
member.summary: Describes possible values for File Permission Copy Mode header.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Permission Copy Mode.Source
member.summary: Copy file permissions from source to destination.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Permission Copy Mode.Override
member.summary: Override file permissions on destination with permissions from the request.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Resource Type

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Resource Type.File
member.summary: Indicates entry is of file type.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS File Resource Type.Directory
member.summary: Indicates entry is of directory type.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS Lease Action

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS Lease Action.Acquire
member.summary: Requests a new lease.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS Lease Action.Renew
member.summary: Renews the lease.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS Lease Action.Change
member.summary: Changes the lease ID of an active lease.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS Lease Action.Release
member.summary: Releases the lease

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#Files#AFS Lease Action.Break
member.summary: Breaks the lease, if the file has an active lease

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Access Tier
member.summary: Azure storage offers different access tiers. Azure Blog storage offers access tiers that let you manage the cost of storing large amounts of unstructured data, such as text or binary data.allowing you to store blob object data in the most cost-effective manner. See: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2210394

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Access Tier.Hot
member.summary: Optimized for storing data that is accessed frequently.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Access Tier.Cool
member.summary: Optimized for storing data that is infrequently accessed and stored for at least 30 days.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Access Tier.Archive
member.summary: Optimized for storing data that is rarely accessed and stored for at least 180 days with flexible latency requirements, on the order of hours.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Expiry Option
member.summary: See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2211406

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Public Access
member.summary: Indicator of whether data in the container may be accessed publicly and the level of access.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Public Access.Container
member.summary: Indicates full public read access for container and blob data. Clients can use anonymous requests to enumerate blobs in the container, but cannot enumerate containers in the storage account.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Public Access.Blob
member.summary: Indicates public read access to blob data in this container. The blob data can be read via anonymous request, but container data is not available. Clients cannot enumerate blobs in the container via anonymous request.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Resource Type
member.summary: Indicator of what type the resource is.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Resource Type.File
member.summary: Indicates blob is of file type.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Resource Type.Directory
member.summary: Indicates blob is of directory type.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Type
member.summary: The types of BLOBs supported in Azure Blob Storage. See: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2210594

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Type.BlockBlob
member.summary: Optimized for streaming.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Type.PageBlob
member.summary: Optimized for random read/write operations and provides the ability to write to a range of bytes in a blob.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Blob Type.AppendBlob
member.summary: Optimized for append operations.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Block List Type
member.summary: Specifies whether to return the list of committed blocks, the list of uncommitted blocks, or both lists together

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Lease Action
member.summary: The types of allowed lease operations See: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2210594

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Lease Action.Acquire
member.summary: Requests a new lease.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Lease Action.Renew
member.summary: Renews the lease.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Lease Action.Change
member.summary: Changes the lease ID of an active lease.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Lease Action.Release
member.summary: Releases the lease

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Lease Action.Break
member.summary: Breaks the lease, if the blob has an active lease

member.name: O:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Rehydrate Priority
member.summary: Indicates the priority with which to rehydrate an archived blob. The priority can be set on a blob only one time. This header will be ignored on subsequent requests to the same blob. The default priority without this header is Standard.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Rehydrate Priority.Standard
member.summary: Standard priority. Default value.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Rehydrate Priority.High
member.summary: High priority

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Optional Parameters.ReturnUserPrincipalName(Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value for 'x-ms-upn' HttpHeader for a request. Version 2020-06-12 and later. Valid for accounts with hierarchical namespace enabled. If the user identity values that are returned in the x-ms-owner are true, they're transformed from Azure Active Directory object IDs to user principal names. If the values are false, they're returned as Azure Active Directory object IDs. The default value is false. Note that group and application object IDs are not translated, because they don't have unique friendly names.
member.param: Boolean value specifying the HttpHeader value

The delimiter may be a single character or a string.
member.param: Delimiting character/string

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Optional Parameters.MaxResults(Integer)
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of blobs to be fetch, from 1 to 5000 if not defined it will fetch 5000 If more than 5000 blobs then use NextMarker to fetch the next set of blobs. In certain cases, the service might return fewer results than specified by maxresults, and also return a continuation token. Setting maxresults to a value less than or equal to zero results in error response code 400 (Bad Request). see: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/list-blobs?tabs=azure-ad#uri-parameters
member.param: Max. number of results to fetch. Must be positive between 1 - 5000

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Optional Parameters.NextMarker(Text)
member.summary: Specifies the NextMarker of blobs to fetch see: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/list-blobs?tabs=azure-ad#uri-parameters
member.param: NextMarker From previous response to fetch the next 5000 or what you have defined in MaxResults

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Azure#Storage#ABS Optional Parameters.BlockId(Text)
member.summary: Identifiers the ID of a Block in BlockBlob
member.param: A valid Base64 string value that identifies the block. Prior to encoding, the string must be less than or equal to 64 bytes

members.member:
Specifies one or more datasets to include in the response.

member.name: O:Table::System#Azure#Storage#SAS Parameters
member.summary: Optional parameters for Shared Access Signature authorization for Azure Storage Services. see: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2210398

member.name: F:Table::System#Azure#Storage#SAS Parameters.ApiVersion
member.summary: Specifies the storage service version to use to execute the request made using the account SAS URI.

member.name: F:Table::System#Azure#Storage#SAS Parameters.SignedStart
member.summary: The time at which the SAS becomes valid, expressed in one of the accepted ISO 8601 UTC formats. If omitted, the start time is assumed to be the time when the storage service receives the request.

member.name: F:Table::System#Azure#Storage#SAS Parameters.SignedIp[2048]
member.summary: Specifies an IP address or a range of IP addresses from which to accept requests. When specifying a range, note that the range is inclusive.

member.name: F:Table::System#Azure#Storage#SAS Parameters.SignedProtocol
member.summary: Specifies the protocol permitted for a request made with the account SAS. Possible values are both HTTPS and HTTP (https,http) or HTTPS only (https)
member.remarks: Note that HTTP only is not a permitted value.

member.name: F:Table::System#Azure#Storage#SAS Parameters.SignedEncryptionScope[63]
member.summary: Indicates the encryption scope to use to encrypt the request contents. This field is supported with version 2020-12-06 and later. See also: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/create-account-sas#specify-the-encryption-scope The name of the encryption scope within the specified storage account. Encryption scope names must be between 3 and 63 characters in length and use numbers, lower-case letters and dash (-) only Every dash (-) character must be immediately preceded and followed by a letter or number. See also: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storagerp/encryption-scopes/put?tabs=HTTP#uri-parameters

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Security#AccessControl#Permission Set Relation.CopyPermissionSet(Code[30],Text,Code[30],Guid,Option,Enum::System#Security#AccessControl#Permission Set Copy Type)
member.summary: CopyPermissionSet will copy the source permission set using the specified copy type.
member.param: The role ID of the new permission set that permissions are copied to.
The name of the new permission set that permissions are copied to.
The role ID of the source permission set that permissions are copied from.
The app ID of the source permission set that permissions are copied from.
The scope of the source permission set that permissions are copied from.

The type of copy operation to use. If the value is set to reference it will copy by creating a new permission set that includes the source set. If the value is set to flat it will copy by flattening all the permissions in the source set and adding them to the new set. If the value is set to clone it will copy by adding the same permissions and including the same permission sets as the source set.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Security#AccessControl#Security Group Impl#.RemoveOrphanedEntraGroups
member.summary: Removes orphaned groups from the system. An orphaned group is a group that has no corresponding security group record.
member.remarks: It is possible to have a User record corresponding to a security group without a Security Group record, because the function NavUserAccountHelper.CreateUserFromAAdGroupObjectId inserts the user record in a separate session. So, if there is an error in the process after was called, the changes to the User table are not rolled back.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Security#Authentication#OAuth2
member.summary: Contains methods supporting authentication via OAuth 2.0 protocol.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Security#Authentication#OAuth2.AcquireTokenByAuthorizationCodeWithCertificate(Text,Text,Text,Text,Text,Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction,Text@,Text@):Boolean
member.summary: Gets the authorization token based on the authorization code via the OAuth2 v1.0 code grant flow.
member.param: The Application (client) ID that the "Azure portal – App registrations" experience assigned to your app.
The Base64-encoded certificate for the Application (client) configured in the "Azure Portal - Certificates & Secrets".
The identity authorization provider URL.

The redirectURL of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirectURLs you registered in the portal. If this parameter is empty, the default Business Central URL will be used.
The Application ID of the resource the application is requesting access to. This parameter can be empty.
Indicates the type of user interaction that is required.
Exit parameter containing the access token. When this parameter is empty, check the AuthCodeErr for a description of the error.
Exit parameter containing the encountered error in the authorization code grant flow. This parameter will be empty in case the token is aquired successfuly.

A list of scopes that you want the user to consent to.
Indicates the type of user interaction that is required.
Exit parameter containing the access token. When this parameter is empty, check the AuthCodeErr for a description of the error.
Exit parameter containing the encountered error in the authorization code grant flow. This parameter will be empty in case the token is aquired successfuly.

The Base64-encoded certificate for the Application (client) configured in the Azure Portal - Certificates & Secrets.
Password for the certificate.

The redirectURL of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirectURLs you registered in the portal. If this parameter is empty, the default Business Central URL will be used.
A list of scopes that you want the user to consent to.
Exit parameter containing the access token.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction
member.summary: This enum contains the Prompt Interaction values possible for OAuth 2.0.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction.None
member.summary: No prompt parameter in the request

member.name: E:Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction.Login
member.summary: The user should be prompted to reauthenticate.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction.Select Account
member.summary: The user is prompted to select an account, interrupting single sign on. The user may select an existing signed-in account, enter their credentials for a remembered account, or choose to use a different account altogether.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction.Consent
member.summary: User consent has been granted, but needs to be updated. The user should be prompted to consent.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Security#Authentication#Prompt Interaction.Admin Consent
member.summary: An administrator should be prompted to consent on behalf of all users in their organization.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Security#Encryption#Cryptography Management
member.summary: Provides helper functions for encryption and hashing. For encryption in an on-premises versions, use it to turn encryption on or off, and import and export the encryption key. Encryption is always turned on for online versions.

member.returns: Plain text.

the list of feature ids that must be excluded from the result buffer

member.returns: if the feature key record was found

member.name: M:Interface::System#Environment#Configuration#Feature Management.GenerateDependencies(Feature Key Buffer@,Feature Dependency@):Boolean

member.returns: if any feature dependency was generated

member.name: O:Page::System#Apps#Extension Management
member.summary: Lists the available extensions, and provides features for managing them.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Apps#Extension Marketplace
member.summary: This codeunit is used as a helper for managing interactions between Business Central and the AppSource marketplace. The marketplace provides a gallery that users can use to select and install Extensions published (an thus available) on Business Central. When and item is selected from the gallery, a JSON object is returned and needs to be parsed for the key information we need to perform an install. At current the key pieces of that object look like this: "msgType":"<type name string>", "data": "applicationId":"<string identifier for selected extension>", "telemetryUrl":"<url>",

member.name: O:Page::System#Apps#Extension Marketplace

member.name: O:Enum::System#Apps#Extension Sync Mode
member.summary: Specifies how to sync the extension.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Apps#Extension Sync Mode.Add
member.summary: Modifies the database schema by creating or extending the tables required to satisfy the app's metadata. This mode considers existing versions of the specified app in its calculations.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Apps#Extension Sync Mode.Force Sync
member.summary: A destructive sync mode which makes the resulting schema match the extension in question regardless of its starting state. This means no change is off limits. This also means that changes which delete things (tables, fields, etc.) also delete the data they contain.
member.remarks: This mode is intended for use when e.g. renaming tables. It can lead to data loss if used without caution.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#Auto Format
member.summary: Exposes functionality to format the appearance of decimal data types in fields of a table, report, or page.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Auto Format.ResolveAutoFormat(Enum::System#Text#Auto Format,Text[80]):Text[80]
member.summary: Formats the appearance of decimal data types. Use this method if you need to format decimals for text message in the same way how system formats decimals in fields.
member.param: A value that determines how data is formatted. The values that are available are "0" and "11". Use "0" to ignore the value that AutoFormatExpr passes and use the standard format for decimals instead. Use "11" to apply a specific format in AutoFormatExpr without additional transformation.
An expression that specifies how to format data.
member.returns: The resolved expression that defines data formatting

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Auto Format.ReadRounding:Decimal
member.summary: Gets the default rounding precision.
member.returns: Returns the rounding precision.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Auto Format.OnAfterResolveAutoFormat(Enum::System#Text#Auto Format,Text[80],Text[80]@)
member.summary: Integration event to resolve the ResolveAutoFormat procedure.
member.param: A value that determines how data is formatted.
An expression that specifies how to format data.
A resolved expression that defines how to format data.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Auto Format.OnResolveAutoFormat(Enum::System#Text#Auto Format,Text[80],Text[80]@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Event that is called to resolve cases for AutoFormatTypes other that "0" and "11". Subscribe to this event if you want to introduce new AutoFormatTypes.
member.param: A value that determines how data is formatted.
An expression that specifies how to format data.

The resolved expression that defines data formatting. For example '<Precision,4:4><Standard Format,2> suffix' that depending on your regional settings will format decimal into "-12345.6789 suffix" or "-12345,6789 suffix".
A value that describes whether the data formatting expression is correct.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Auto Format.OnReadRounding(Decimal@)
member.summary: Integration event to resolve the ReadRounding procedure.
member.param: The decimal value precision.

member.summary: Formats the appearance of decimal data types.

member.summary: Ignore the value that AutoFormatExpr passes and use the standard format for decimals instead.

member.summary: Apply a specific format in AutoFormatExpr without additional transformation.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens
member.summary: Exposes functionality that allow users to specify pre-defined filter tokens that get converted to the correct values for various data types when filtering records.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.MakeDateFilter(Text@)
member.summary: Turns text that represents date formats into a valid date filter expression with respect to filter tokens and date formulas. Call this function from onValidate trigger of page field that should behave similar to system filters. The text from which the date filter should be extracted passed as VAR. For example: "YESTERDAY", or " 01-01-2012 ".

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.MakeTimeFilter(Text@)
member.summary: Turns text that represents a time into a valid time filter with respect to filter tokens. Call this function from onValidate trigger of page field that should behave similar to system filters.
member.param: The text from which the time filter should be extracted, passed as VAR. For example: "NOW".

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.MakeTextFilter(Text@)
member.summary: Turns text into a valid text filter with respect to filter tokens. Call this function from onValidate trigger of page field that should behave similar to system filters.
member.param: The expression from which the text filter should be extracted, passed as VAR. For example: "ME".

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.MakeDateTimeFilter(Text@)
member.summary: Turns text that represents a DateTime into a valid date and time filter with respect to filter tokens. Call this function from onValidate trigger of page field that should behave similar to system filters.
member.param: The text from which the date and time should be extracted, passed as VAR. For example: "NOW" or "01-01-2012 11:11:11..NOW".

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.OnResolveDateFilterToken(Text,Date@,Date@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Use this event if you want to add support for additional tokens that user will be able to use when working with date filters, for example "Christmas" or "StoneAge". Ensure that in your subscriber you check that what user entered contains your keyword, then return proper date range for your filter token.
member.param: The date token to resolve, for example: "Summer".
The start date to resolve from DateToken that the filter will use, for example: "01/06/2019". Passed by reference by using VAR keywords.
The end date to resolve from DateToken that the filter will use, for example: "31/08/2019". Passed by reference by using VAR keywords.
Stores whether the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.OnResolveTextFilterToken(Text,Text@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Use this event if you want to add support for additional filter tokens that user will be able to use when working with text or code filters, for example "MyFilter". Ensure that in your subscriber you check that what user entered contains your token, then return properly formatted text for your filter token.
member.param: The text token to resolve.
The text to translate into a properly formatted text filter.
Stores whether the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.OnResolveTimeFilterToken(Text,Time@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Use this event if you want to add support for additional filter tokens that user will be able to use when working with time filters, for example "Lunch". Ensure that in your subscriber you check that what user entered contains your token, then return properly formatted time for your filter token.
member.param: The time token to resolve, for example: "Lunch".
The text to translate into a properly formatted time filter, for example: "12:00:00".
Stores whether the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.OnResolveDateTokenFromDateTimeFilter(Text,Date@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Use this event if you want to add support for additional filter tokens that user will be able to use as date in DateTime filters. Parses and translates a date token into a date filter.
member.param: The date token to resolve, for example: "Christmas".
The text to translate into a properly formatted date filter, for example: "25/12/2019".
Stores whether the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Text#Filter Tokens.OnResolveTimeTokenFromDateTimeFilter(Text,Time@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Use this event if you want to add support for additional filter tokens that user will be able to use as time in DateTime filters. Parses and translates a time token into a time filter.
member.param: The time token to resolve, for example: "Lunch".
The text to translate into a properly formatted time filter, for example:"12:00:00".
Stores whether the operation was successful.

member.name: O:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings
member.summary: Common setting used when encoding barcodes.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings.Code Set
member.summary: Code set option used by Code128 symbology

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings.Allow Extended Charset
member.summary: Setting used in Code39 and Code93 symbologies.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings.Enable Checksum
member.summary: Flag to indicate whether to enable checksum when encoding the barcode. Used by barcode symbology Code39.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings.Use mod 10
member.summary: Barcode symbology Interleaved 2 of 5 setting.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology
member.summary: The available barcode symbologies.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 - An alpha-numeric barcode that encodes uppercase letters, numbers and some symbols; it is also referred to as Barcode/39, the 3 of 9 Code and LOGMARS Code.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar - A numeric barcode encoding numbers with a slightly higher density than Code 39.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.Code128
member.summary: Code 128 - Alpha-numeric barcode with three character sets. Supports Code-128, GS1-128 (Formerly known as UCC/EAN-128) and ISBT-128.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.Code93
member.summary: Code 93 - Similar to Code 39, but requires two checksum characters.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.Interleaved2of5
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 - The Interleaved 2 of 5 barcode symbology encodes numbers in pairs, similar to Code 128 set C.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.Postnet
member.summary: Postenet - The Intelligent Mail customer barcode combines the information of both the POSTNET and PLANET symbologies, and additional information, into a single barcode that is about the same size as the traditional POSTNET symbol.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.MSI
member.summary: MIS - The MSI Plessey barcode symbology was designed in the 1970s by the Plessey Company in England and has practiced primarily in libraries and retail applications.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.EAN-8
member.summary: EAN-8 - The MSI Plessey barcode symbology was designed in the 1970s by the Plessey Company in England and has practiced primarily in libraries and retail applications.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.EAN-13
member.summary: EAN-13 - The EAN-13 was developed as a superset of UPC-A, adding an extra digit to the beginning of every UPC-A number.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.UPC-A
member.summary: UPC-A - The Universal Product Code (UPC; redundantly: UPC code) is a barcode symbology that is widely used in the United States, Canada, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, and other countries/regions for tracking trade items in stores.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology.UPC-E
member.summary: UPC-E - To allow the use of UPC barcodes on smaller packages, where a full 12-digit barcode may not fit, a 'zero-suppressed version of UPC was developed, called UPC-E.

member.name: O:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings 2D
member.summary: Common setting used when encoding 2D barcodes.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings 2D.Error Correction Level
member.summary: Error Correction Level option used by QR code symbology.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings 2D.Module Size
member.summary: Module Size option used by QR code symbology.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings 2D.Quite Zone Width
member.summary: Quite Zone Width option used by QR code symbology.

member.name: F:Table::System#Text#Barcode Encode Settings 2D.Code Page
member.summary: Code Page option used by QR code symbology.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology 2D
member.summary: The available 2D barcode symbologies.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology 2D.Aztec
member.summary: Aztec barcodes are very efficient two-dimensional (2D) symbologies that use square modules with a unique finder pattern in the middle of the symbol, which helps the barcode scanner to determine cell locations to decode the symbol. Characters, numbers, text and bytes of data may be encoded in an Aztec barcode. The IDAutomation implementation of the Aztec barcode symbol is based on the ISO standard version released into the public domain by its inventor, Honeywell.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology 2D.Data Matrix
member.summary: Data Matrix is a very efficient, two-dimensional (2D) barcode symbology that uses a small area of square modules with a unique perimeter pattern, which helps the barcode scanner determine cell locations and decode the symbol. Characters, numbers, text and actual bytes of data may be encoded, including Unicode characters and photos. The encoding and decoding process of Data Matrix is very complex. Several methods have been used for error correction in the past. All current implementations have been standardized on the ECC200 error correction method, which is approved by ANSI/AIM BC11 and the ISO/IEC 16022 specification. IDAutomation 2D Data Matrix barcode products all support ECC200 by default and are based on the ANSI/AIM BC11 and the ISO/IEC 16022 specifications. The Reed-Solomon error correction algorithms of ECC200 allow the recognition of barcodes that are up to 60% damaged.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology 2D.Maxi Code
member.summary: Maxicode is an international 2D (two-dimensional) barcode that is currently used by UPS on shipping labels for world-wide addressing and package sortation. MaxiCode symbols are fixed in size and are made up of offset rows of hexagonal modules arranged around a unique finder pattern. MaxiCode includes error correction, which enables the symbol to be decoded when it is slightly damaged.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology 2D.PDF417
member.summary: The PDF417 barcode is a two-dimensional (2D), high-density symbology capable of encoding text, numbers, files and actual data bytes. Large amounts of text and data can be stored securely and inexpensively when using the PDF417 barcode symbology. The printed symbol consists of several linear rows of stacked codewords. Each codeword represents 1 of 929 possible values from one of three different clusters. A different cluster is chosen for each row, repeating after every three rows. Because the codewords in each cluster are unique, the scanner is able to determine what line each cluster is from.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Text#Barcode Symbology 2D.QR-Code
member.summary: QR-Code is a two-dimensional (2D) barcode type similar to Data Matrix or Aztec, which is capable of encoding large amounts of data. QR means Quick Response, as the inventor intended the symbol to be quickly decoded. The data encoded in a QR-Code may include alphabetic characters, text, numbers, double characters and URLs. The symbology uses a small area of square modules with a unique perimeter pattern, which helps the barcode scanner determine cell locations to decode the symbol. IDAutomation’s implementation of QR-Code is based on the ISO/IEC 18004:2006 standard (also known as QR-Code 2005) and conforms to ISO/IEC 18004:2015 specifications.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#IDA 1D Code128 Encoder
member.summary: Code-128 barcode font implementation from IDAutomation from: https://www.idautomation.com/barcode-fonts/code-128/ Alpha-numeric barcode with three character sets. Supports Code-128, GS1-128 (Formerly known as UCC/EAN-128) and ISBT-128.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#IDA 1D Code39 Encoder
member.summary: Code-39 barcode font implementation from IDAutomation from: https://www.idautomation.com/barcode-fonts/code-39/ An alpha-numeric barcode that encodes uppercase letters, numbers and some symbols; it is also referred to as Barcode/39, the 3 of 9 Code and LOGMARS Code.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#IDA 1D Code93 Encoder
member.summary: Code-93 barcode font implementation from IDAutomation from: https://www.idautomation.com/barcode-fonts/code-93/ Similar to Code 39, but requires two checksum characters.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#IDA 1D EAN13 Encoder
member.summary: EAN-13 barcode font implementation from IDAutomation from: https://www.barcodefaq.com/barcode-properties/symbologies/ean-13/ Is most commonly used to encode 13 digits of the GTIN barcode symbology and also to identify books with Bookland or ISBN barcode symbols.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#IDA 1D EAN8 Encoder
member.summary: Ean-8 barcode font implementation from IDAutomation from: https://www.barcodefaq.com/barcode-properties/symbologies/ean-8/ An EAN-8 is an EAN/UPC symbology barcode and is derived from the longer International Article Number (EAN-13) code

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Text#IDA 1D I2of5 Encoder
member.summary: ITF barcode font implementation from IDAutomation from: https://www.idautomation.com/barcode-fonts/interleaved-2of5/ Interleaved 2 of 5 (ITF) is a numeric only barcode used to encode pairs of numbers into a self-checking, high-density barcode format

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Utilities#Uri Builder.AddQueryFlag(Text,Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour)
member.summary: Adds a flag to the query string of this UriBuilder. In case the same query flag exists already, the action in is taken.
member.param: A flag to add to the query string of this UriBuilder. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Cannot be empty.
Specifies which action to take if the flag already exist.
member.error: If the provided is empty.
If the provided is "Throw Error" and the flag already exists in the URI.
If the provided is not a valid value for the enum.
member.remarks: This function could alter the order of the existing query string parts. For example, if the previous URL was "https://microsoft.com?foo=bar&john=doe" and the new flag is "contoso", the result could be "https://microsoft.com?john=doe&foo=bar&contoso".

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Utilities#Uri Builder.AddQueryFlag(Text)
member.summary: Adds a flag to the query string of this UriBuilder. In case the same query flag exists already, only one occurrence is kept.
member.param: A flag to add to the query string of this UriBuilder. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Cannot be empty.
member.error: If the provided is empty.
member.remarks: This function could alter the order of the existing query string parts. For example, if the previous URL was "https://microsoft.com?foo=bar&john=doe" and the new flag is "contoso", the result could be "https://microsoft.com?john=doe&foo=bar&contoso".

This function will encode OData parameters (and will ensure encoding of the ones added to the before). For example "$skip=3" will result in "%24skip=3". Some servers don't support the encoded version. Use in these cases instead.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Utilities#Uri Builder.AddQueryParameter(Text,Text,Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour)
member.summary: Adds a parameter key-value pair to the query string of this UriBuilder (in the form ParameterKey=ParameterValue). In case the same query key exists already, the action in is taken.
member.param: The key for the new query parameter. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Cannot be empty.
The value for the new query parameter. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Can be empty.
Specifies which action to take if the ParameterKey specified already exist.
member.error: If the provided is empty.
If the provided is "Throw Error".
If the provided is not a valid value for the enum.
member.remarks: This function could alter the order of the existing query string parts. For example, if the previous URL was "https://microsoft.com?foo=bar&john=doe" and the new flag is "contoso=42", the result could be "https://microsoft.com?john=doe&foo=bar&contoso=42".

This function will encode OData parameters (and will ensure encoding of the ones added to the before). For example "$skip=3" will result in "%24skip=3". Some servers don't support the encoded version. Use in these cases instead.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Utilities#Uri Builder.AddQueryParameter(Text,Text)
member.summary: Adds a parameter key-value pair to the query string of this UriBuilder (in the form ParameterKey=ParameterValue). In case the same query key exists already, its value is overwritten.
member.param: The key for the new query parameter. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Cannot be empty.
The value for the new query parameter. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Can be empty.
member.error: If the provided is empty.
member.remarks: This function could alter the order of the existing query string parts. For example, if the previous URL was "https://microsoft.com?foo=bar&john=doe" and the new flag is "contoso=42", the result could be "https://microsoft.com?john=doe&foo=bar&contoso=42".

This function will encode OData parameters (and will ensure encoding of the ones added to the before). For example "$skip=3" will result in "%24skip=3". Some servers don't support the encoded version. Use in these cases instead.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Utilities#Uri Builder.AddODataQueryParameter(Text,Text)
member.summary: Adds an OData parameter key-value pair to the query string of this UriBuilder (in the form ParameterKey=ParameterValue), preserving the "$" sign in unencoded form. In case the same query key exists already, its value is overwritten.
member.param: The key for the new query parameter. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string, except for any "$" sign. Cannot be empty.
The value for the new query parameter. This value will be encoded before being added to the URI query string. Can be empty.
member.error: If the provided is empty.
member.remarks: This function could alter the order of the existing query string parts. For example, if the previous URL was "https://microsoft.com?foo=bar&john=doe" and the new flag is "contoso=42", the result could be "https://microsoft.com?john=doe&foo=bar&contoso=42".

This function might modify existing query parameters to apply the same encoding rules. For example if the URL is "https://microsoft.com?%24top=1" and the new flag is "$skip=42", the result could be "https://microsoft.com?$skip=42&$top=1".

member.name: O:Enum::System#Utilities#UriKind
member.summary: Defines the different kinds of URIs.
member.remarks: Visit https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.urikind for more information.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#UriKind.RelativeOrAbsolute
member.summary: The URI kind is indeterminate.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#UriKind.Absolute
member.summary: The URI is absolute.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#UriKind.Relative
member.summary: The URI is relative.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour
member.summary: Specifies the behaviour when adding a new query parameter or flag to a URI.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour.Skip
member.summary: Skips adding the value if the same flag or parameter already exists.
member.example: Adding "foo=bar" to "https://microsoft.com?foo=goofy" and using this option results in "https://microsoft.com?foo=goofy".

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour.Overwrite All Matching
member.summary: Keeps the new value (overwrites all existing matching flags or parameters).
member.example: Adding "foo=bar" to "https://microsoft.com?foo=goofy" and using this option results in "https://microsoft.com?foo=bar".

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour.Keep All
member.summary: Keeps both the existing values and the new value.
member.example: Adding "foo=bar" to "https://microsoft.com?foo=goofy" and using this option results in "https://microsoft.com?foo=goofy&foo=bar".

member.name: E:Enum::System#Utilities#Uri Query Duplicate Behaviour.Throw Error
member.summary: Throws an error if the flag or parameter already exists.
member.example: Adding "foo=bar" to "https://microsoft.com?foo=goofy" and using this option results in an error.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Data Type
member.summary: Contains the possible data types that business chart can show.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Data Type.String
member.summary: String type, corresponds to 'System.String'

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Data Type.Integer
member.summary: Integer type, corresponds to 'System.Int32'

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Data Type.Decimal
member.summary: Decimal type, corresponds to 'System.Decimal'

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Data Type.DateTime
member.summary: DateTime type, corresponds to 'System.DateTime'

member.name: O:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type
member.summary: Represents all the available types of business charts

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Point
member.summary: Uses points to represent data points.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Bubble
member.summary: A variation of the Point chart type, where the data points are replaced by bubbles of different sizes.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Line
member.summary: Illustrates trends in data with the passing of time.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.StepLine
member.summary: Similar to the Line chart type, but uses vertical and horizontal lines to connect the data points in a series forming a step-like progression.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Column
member.summary: Uses a sequence of columns to compare values across categories.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.StackedColumn
member.summary: Used to compare the contribution of each value to a total across categories.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.StackedColumn100
member.summary: Displays multiple series of data as stacked columns. The cumulative proportion of each stacked element is always 100% of the Y axis.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Area
member.summary: Emphasizes the degree of change over time and shows the relationship of the parts to a whole.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.StackedArea
member.summary: An Area chart that stacks two or more data series on top of one another.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.StackedArea100
member.summary: Displays multiple series of data as stacked areas. The cumulative proportion of each stacked element is always 100% of the Y axis.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Pie
member.summary: Shows how proportions of data, shown as pie-shaped pieces, contribute to the data as a whole.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Doughnut
member.summary: Similar to the Pie chart type, except that it has a hole in the center.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Range
member.summary: Displays a range of data by plotting two Y values per data point, with each Y value being drawn as a line chart.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Radar
member.summary: A circular chart that is used primarily as a data comparison tool.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Business Chart Type.Funnel
member.summary: Displays in a funnel shape data that equals 100% when totaled.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs
member.summary: Exposes functionality to set up and retrieve styles for cues.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.OpenCustomizePageForCurrentUser(Integer)
member.summary: Opens the cue setup user page with an implicit filter on table id. The page shows previously added entries in the Cue Setup Administration page that have the UserId being either the current user or blank. The page also displays all other fields the that the passed table might have of type decimal or integer. Closing this page will transfer any changed or added setup entries to the cue setup table.
member.param: The ID of the table for which the page will be customized.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.ChangeUserForSetupEntry(RecordRef@,Text[30],Text[50])
member.summary: Changes the user of a cue setup entry. A Recref pointing to the newly modified record is returned by var.
member.param: The recordref that poins to the record that will be modified.
The company in which the table will be modified.
The new UserName to which the setup entry will belong to.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.SetCueStyle(Integer,Integer,Decimal,Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style@)
member.summary: Retrieves a Cues And KPIs Style enum based on the cue setup of the provided TableId, FieldID and Amount. The computed cue style is returned by var.
member.param: The ID of the table containing the field for which the style is wanted.
The ID of the field for which the style is wanted.
The amount for which the style will be calculated based on the threshold values of the setup.
The amount for which the style will be calculated based on the threshold values of the setup

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.PersonalizedCueSetupExistsForCurrentUser(Integer,Integer):Boolean
member.summary: Checks if a personalized Cue Setup record exists for the current user. The ID of the table containing the field for which the style is wanted. The ID of the field for which the style is wanted.
member.returns: If a personalized Cue Setup record exists for the current user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.ConvertStyleToStyleText(Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style):Text
member.summary: Converts a Cues And KPIs Style enum to a style text. Enum values 0,7,8,9,10 are defined by default, if custom values are needed take a look at OnConvertStyleToStyleText event.
member.param: A Cues And KPIs Style enum from which the style text will be converted.
member.returns: The converted style

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.InsertData(Integer,Integer,Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style,Decimal,Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style,Decimal,Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style):Boolean
member.summary: Inserts cue setup data. The entries inserted via this method will have no value for the userid field.
member.param: The ID of the table where the cue is defined.
The ID of the field which the cue is based on.
A Cues And KPIs Style enum representing the style that cues which have a value under threshold 1 will take.
The lower amount which defines which style cues get based on their value
A Cues And KPIs Style enum representing the style that cues which have a value over threshold 1 but under threshold 2 will take.
The upper amount which defines which style cues get based on their value
A Cues And KPIs Style enum representing the style that cues which have a value over threshold 2 will take.
member.returns: True if the data was inserted successfully, false otherwise

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.OnConvertStyleToStyleText(Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style,Text@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Event that is called to convert from the style enum to a text value in case of extended enum values. Subscribe to this event if you want to introduce new cue styles.
member.param: A Cues And KPIs Style enum from which the style text will be converted.
A text vaue returned by var, which is the result of the conversion from the style enum.
A boolean value that describes whether or not the custom conversion was executed.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs.OnBeforeGetCustomizedCueStyleOption(Integer,Integer,Decimal,Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style@,Boolean@)
member.summary: Event that allows definition of cue style for a cue using style enum without the usage of a cue setup table. Subscribe to this event if you want to define a cue style for a cue using custom prerequisites.
member.param: The ID of the table where the cue is defined.
The ID of the field which the cue is based on.
Cue value parameter that can be used to determine cue style.
Exit parameter that holds newly determined cue style based on custom prerequisites.
A boolean value that describes whether or not the cue style has been determined.

member.name: O:Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style
member.summary: This enum has the styles for the cues and KPIs on RoleCenter pages. The values match the original option field on the Cue Setup table, values 1 to 6 are blank options to be extended.

member.summary: Specifies that the Unfavorable style will be used when rendering the cue.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style.Ambiguous
member.summary: Specifies that the Ambiguous style will be used when rendering the cue.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Visualization#Cues And KPIs Style.Subordinate
member.summary: Specifies that the Subordinate style will be used when rendering the cue.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines
member.summary:
Various functions related to headlines functionality.
Payload - the main text of the headline. Qualifier - smaller text, hint to the payload. Expression property - value for the field on the page with type HeadlinePart.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.Truncate(Text,Integer):Text
member.summary: Truncate the text from the end for its length to be no more than MaxLength. If the text has to be shortened, "..." is be added at the end.
member.param: Text that be shortened in order to fit on the headline.
The maximal length of the string. Usually obtained through or function.
member.returns: The truncated text

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.Emphasize(Text):Text
member.summary: Emphasize a string of text in the headline. Applies the style to the text.
member.param: The text that the style will be applied on.
member.returns: Emphasized text (special tags are added to the input).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.GetHeadlineText(Text,Text,Text@):Boolean
member.summary: Combine the text from Qualifier and Payload in order to get a single string with headline text. This text is usually assigned to Expression property on the HeadlinePart page.
member.param: The text to be displayed on the qualifier (smaller text above the main one) of the headline (parts of it can be emphasized, see ).
The text to be displayed on the payload (the main text of the headline) of the headline (parts of it can be emphasized, see ).
Output parameter. Contains the combined text, ready to be assigned to the Expression property, if the function returns 'true', the unchanged value otherwise.
member.returns: 'false' if payload is empty, or payload is too long, or qualifier is too long, 'true' otherwise.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.GetUserGreetingText:Text
member.summary: Get a greeting text for the current user relevant to the time of the day. Timespans and correspondant greetings: 00:00-10:59 Good morning, John Doe! 11:00-13:59 Hi, John Doe! 14:00-18:59 Good afternoon, John Doe! 19:00-23:59 Good evening, John Doe! if the user name is blank for the current user, simplified version is used (for example, "Good afternoon!").
member.returns: The greeting text.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.ShouldUserGreetingBeVisible:Boolean
member.summary: Determines if a greeting text should be visible.
member.returns: True if the user logged in less than 10 minutes ago, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.GetMaxQualifierLength:Integer
member.summary: The accepted maximum length of a qualifier.
member.returns: The number of characters, 50.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Visualization#Headlines.GetMaxPayloadLength:Integer
member.summary: The accepted maximum length of a payload.
member.returns: The number of characters, 75.

member.summary: Takes a picture from a camera on the client device and returns the data in the InStream.

A generated name for the taken picture. It will include the current date and time (for example, "Picture_05_03_2020_12_49_23.jpeg").

member.param: Sets the quality of the saved image, expressed as a number between 0 and 100, where 100 is the highest available resolution.
An InStream object that will hold the image in case taking a picture was successful.
A generated name for the taken picture. It will include the current date and time (for example, "Picture_05_03_2020_12_49_23.jpeg").
member.returns: True if the camera is available, the user took a picture and decided to use it, false otherwise.
member.error: The picture quality must be in the range from 0 to 100.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Device#Printer Setup.OnSetAsDefaultPrinter(Text,Text,Boolean@)
member.summary: Integration event that is called to set the default printer for all reports. Subscribe to this event to specify a value in the Printer Name field and leave the User ID and Report ID fields blank in Printers Selection.
member.param: A value that determines the printer being set as default.
A value that determines the user for whom the printer is being set as default. Empty value implies all users.
Stores whether the operation was successful.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel
member.summary: This codeunit provides an interface to running Edit in Excel for a specific page.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.EditPageInExcel(Text[240],Text,Text)
member.summary: Creates web service for the specified page, and uses the web service to prepare and download an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality.
member.param: The name of the page. This will be used for the name of the downloaded excel file, additionally the web service will be called [PageCaption]_Excel. Note if the PageCaption starts with a digit, the web service name will be WS[PageCaption]_Excel.
The ID of the page, for example, "21".
The Business Central filter to be applied in Edit in Excel.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.EditPageInExcel(Text[240],Integer)
member.summary: Creates web service for the specified page, and uses the web service to prepare and download an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality.
member.param: The name of the page. This will be used for the name of the downloaded excel file, additionally the web service will be called [PageCaption]_Excel. Note if the PageCaption starts with a digit, the web service name will be WS[PageCaption]_Excel.
The ID of the page, for example, 21.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.EditPageInExcel(Text[240],Integer,Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel Filters)
member.summary: Creates web service for the specified page, and uses the web service to prepare and download an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality.
member.param: The name of the page. This will be used for the name of the downloaded excel file, additionally the web service will be called [PageCaption]_Excel. Note if the PageCaption starts with a digit, the web service name will be WS[PageCaption]_Excel.
The ID of the page, for example, 21.
The filters which will be applied to Edit in Excel.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.EditPageInExcel(Text[240],Text,Text,Text)
member.summary: Creates web service for the specified page, and uses the web service to prepare and download an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality.
member.param: The name of the page. This will be used for the name of the downloaded excel file, if the FileName parameter is not set. Additionally, the web service will be called [PageCaption]_Excel. Note if the PageCaption starts with a digit, the web service name will be WS[PageCaption]_Excel.
The ID of the page, for example, "21".
The Business Central filter to be applied in Edit in Excel.
The name of the downloaded excel file.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.EditPageInExcel(Text[240],Integer,Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel Filters,Text)
member.summary: Creates web service for the specified page, and uses the web service to prepare and download an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality.
member.param: The name of the page. This will be used for the name of the downloaded excel file, if the FileName parameter is not set. Additionally, the web service will be called [PageCaption]_Excel. Note if the PageCaption starts with a digit, the web service name will be WS[PageCaption]_Excel.
The ID of the page, for example, 21.
The filters which will be applied to Edit in Excel.
The name of the downloaded excel file.

member.summary: Prepares an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality by using the specified web service, and downloads the file.

The search filter of the user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.GenerateExcelWorkBook(Tenant Web Service,Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel Filters)
member.summary: Prepares an Excel file for the Edit in Excel functionality by using the specified web service, and downloads the file.
member.param: The web service referenced through Edit in Excel.
The filters which will be applied to Edit in Excel.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.OnEditInExcel(Text[240],Text,Text,Boolean@)
member.summary: This event is called when Edit in Excel is invoked, accepting Filter in Text format. It allows overriding the Edit in Excel functionality.
member.param: The name of the web service already created for use with Edit in Excel.
The Business Central filter to be applied in Edit in Excel.
The search filter of the user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.OnEditInExcelWithStructuredFilter(Text[240],JsonObject,JsonObject,Text,Boolean@)
member.summary: This event is called when Edit in Excel is invoked, handling JSON structured filters. It also allows overriding the Edit in Excel functionality. It is however recommended to use OnEditInExcelWithFilters below if possible to avoid taking dependency on a given structure.
member.param: The name of the web service already created for use with Edit in Excel.
Business Central Filter to be applied in Edit in Excel.
Object binding the name of the filtered field with its EdmType
The search filter of the user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel.OnEditInExcelWithFilters(Text[240],Codeunit::System#Integration#Excel#Edit in Excel Filters@,Text,Boolean@)
member.summary: This event is called when the Edit in Excel system action is invoked or EditInExcel is called in this codeunit. It allows modifying filters or overriding the Edit in Excel functionality completely.
member.param: The name of the web service already created for use with Edit in Excel.
The filters which will be applied to Edit in Excel.
The search filter of the user.

member.summary: Exposes functionality that gets page summary for a selected page. This codeunit is exposed as a webservice and hence all functions are available through OData calls.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Page Summary Provider.GetPageSummary(Integer,Text):Text
member.returns: Text value for the page summary in JSON format.
member.example:
{ "version":"1.1", "pageCaption":"Customer Card", "pageType":"Card", "summaryType":"Brick", "cardPageId": "0", "fields":[ {"caption":"No.","fieldValue":"01445544","type":"Code"}, {"caption":"Name","fieldValue":"Progressive Home Furnishings","type":"Text"}, {"caption":"Contact","fieldValue":"Mr. Scott Mitchell","type":"Text"}, {"caption":"Balance Due (LCY)","fieldValue":"1.499,03","type":"Decimal"}] } }
In case of an error: { "version":"1.1", "pageCaption":"Customer Card", "pageType":"Card", "summaryType":"Caption", "error":[ "code":"InvalidBookmark" "message":"The bookmark is invalid." ] }

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Page Summary Provider.GetPageSummaryBySystemID(Integer,Guid):Text
member.returns: Text value for the page summary in JSON format.
member.example:
{ "version":"1.1", "pageCaption":"Customer Card", "pageType":"Card", "summaryType":"Brick", "cardPageId": "0", "url":"https://businesscentral.dynamics.com/?company=CRONUS%20International%20Ltd.&page=22&bookmark=27%3bEgAAAAJ7CDAAMQA5ADAANQA4ADkAMw%3d%3", "fields":[ {"caption":"No.","fieldValue":"01445544","type":"Code"}, {"caption":"Name","fieldValue":"Progressive Home Furnishings","type":"Text"}, {"caption":"Contact","fieldValue":"Mr. Scott Mitchell","type":"Text"}, {"caption":"Balance Due (LCY)","fieldValue":"1.499,03","type":"Decimal"}] } }
In case of an error: { "version":"1.1", "pageCaption":"Customer Card", "pageType":"Card", "summaryType":"Caption", "error":[ "code":"InvalidSystemId" "message":"The system id is invalid." ] }

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Page Summary Provider.GetPageSummary(Integer):Text
member.returns: Text value for the page summary in JSON format.
member.example:
{ "version":"1.1", "pageCaption":"Customer Card", "pageType":"Card", "summaryType":"Caption", }
In case of error: { "version":"1.1", "pageCaption":"Customer Card", "pageType":"Card", "summaryType":"Caption", "error":[ "code":"error code" "message":"error message" ] }

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Integration#Page Summary Provider.GetPageUrlBySystemID(Integer,Guid):Text

Whether to copy over all media content. This may cause the call to be very expensive.

member.summary: Returns a list of detached tenant media. This media may be detached by itself or have an detached Media Set pointing to them.

Whether to copy over all media content. This may cause the call to be very expensive.

The record reference on which the filter will be placed.

The record reference on whic the filter will be placed.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DataAdministration#Apply Retention Policy.SetSingleDateExpirationDateFilter(Integer,Date,RecordRef@,Integer,Date)

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DataAdministration#Apply Retention Policy.OnApplyRetentionPolicyRecordLimitExceeded(Integer,Integer,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean@)
member.summary: This event is raised once the maximum number of records which can be deleted in a single run is reached. The limit is defined internally and cannot be changed. The event can be used to schedule a new run to delete the remaining records.
member.param: Specifies the Id of the table on which the limit was reached.
Show the number of records remaining to be deleted for the table specified in CurrTableId.
Specifies where the interupted run was for all retention policies or only one retention policy.
Specifies whether the run was initiated by a user or not.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DataAdministration#Apply Retention Policy.OnApplyRetentionPolicyIndirectPermissionRequired(RecordRef@,Boolean@)
member.summary: This event is raised when the user applying the retention policy has indirect permissions to delete records in the table. A subscriber to this event with indirect permissions can delete the records on behalf of the user.
member.param: The record reference which contains the expired records to be deleted.
Indicates whether the event has been handled.

member.summary:
The table is used as a parameter table for the DeleteRecords method on the Reten. Pol Deleting interface.
if "Indirect Permission Required" is true and the implementation does not have the required indirect permissions, then "Skip Event Indirect Perm. Req." should be set to false. This will allow a subscriber to handle the deletion.
if there are more records to be deleted than as indicated by "Max. Number of Rec. to Delete", then only a number of records equal to "Max. Number of Rec. to Delete" should be deleted. In the case where not all records were deleted, "Skip Event Rec. Limit Exceeded" should be set to false. This will allow either a subscriber or the user to schedule another run to delete the remaining records.
"Total Max. Nr. of Rec. to Del." is provided for information only. This is the maximum number of records recommended to delete in a single run of Apply Retention Policies.
"User Invoked Run" is provided for information only.

member.name: M:Interface::System#DataAdministration#Reten# Pol# Filtering.HasReadPermission(Integer):Boolean
member.summary: This method is used to determine whether the implementation has read permission to the table specified in TableId. The permissions depend on both the user and the implementation codeunit. If the combination of user and implementation codeunit do not have read permission to the table, the retention policy will not be applied. A notification will be shown on the Retention Policy Setup card.
member.param: The ID of the table for a retention policy is defined
member.returns: Returns true if the records in the table can be read.

member.summary: This method is to count the records in the table specified in the RecRef. The method is only called when the base code does not have read permission to the table.
member.param: A record reference.
member.returns: The number of records.
member.example: procedure Count(RecRef:RecordRef): Integer begin exit(RecRef.Count()) end;

member.name: O:Table::System#DataAdministration#Retention Period
member.summary: The Retention Periods table is used to define retention periods. You define a retention period by selecting one of the default values in the Retention Period field, or by selecting the Custom value and providing a date formula. The date formula must result in a date that is at least two days before the current date.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#DataAdministration#PBT Expired Record Count
member.summary:
A page background task can call this codeunit to calculate the number of expired records for a retention policy.
The PageBackgroundParameters dictionary must contain a key called SystemId, and the value of the key must be the SystemId of the Retention Policy Setup record for which to count expired records. The result is returned in the BackgroundTaskResult dictionary where the key is the SystemId value of the Retention Policy Setup record and the value is the number of expired records..

member.summary: This codeunit provides an interface for creating, showing and approving Privacy Notices

Link to the privacy terms.

member.summary: Creates a privacy notice.
member.param: Identification of the privacy notice.
The name of the integration.
Link to the privacy terms.
