member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.GetDefaultPrivacyAgreementTxt:Text
member.summary: Gets the default text for the privacy notice.
member.returns: The default text for the privacy notice.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.ConfirmPrivacyNoticeApproval(Code[50]):Boolean
member.summary:
After this the step-through depends on whether the user is admin or normal user (admin means they have the Priv. Notice - Admin permission set): Admin: If admin has agreed that will be returned Privacy Notice will be shown and the response (Agree/Disagree) will be stored and takes precedence for all users. If the Privacy Notice was simply closed, we return false and nothing is stored. User: If admin has agreed or disagreed, that will be returned If user has agreed, that will be returned Privacy Notice will be shown and any agreement will be stored. If the Privacy Notice was simply closed, we return false and nothing is stored.
This function will open a modal dialog to confirm approval and must hence be run outside a write transaction. The privacy notice referenced must exist.
member.param: Identification of an existing privacy notice.
member.returns: Whether the privacy notice was agreed to.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.ConfirmPrivacyNoticeApproval(Code[50],Boolean):Boolean
member.summary:
After this the step-through depends on whether the user is admin or normal user (admin means they have the Priv. Notice - Admin permission set): Admin: If admin has agreed that will be returned Privacy Notice will be shown and the response (Agree/Disagree) will be stored and takes precedence for all users. If the Privacy Notice was simply closed, we return false and nothing is stored. User: If admin has agreed or disagreed, that will be returned If user has agreed, that will be returned Privacy Notice will be shown and any agreement will be stored. If the Privacy Notice was simply closed, we return false and nothing is stored.
This function will open a modal dialog to confirm approval and must hence be run outside a write transaction. The privacy notice referenced must exist.
member.param: Identification of an existing privacy notice.
If the check should return true if it has not been explicitly disagreed.
member.returns: Whether the privacy notice was agreed to.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.GetPrivacyNoticeApprovalState(Code[50]):Enum::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice Approval State
member.summary:
Returns the state of the privacy notice for the current user without showing any privacy notice to the user.
An error is thrown if the privacy notice does not exist.
member.param: Identification of an existing privacy notice.
member.returns: The state of the privacy notice for the current user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.GetPrivacyNoticeApprovalState(Code[50],Boolean):Enum::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice Approval State
member.summary:
Returns the state of the privacy notice for the current user without showing any privacy notice to the user.
An error is thrown if the privacy notice does not exist.
member.param: Identification of an existing privacy notice.
If the check should return true if it has not been explicitly disagreed.
member.returns: The state of the privacy notice for the current user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.ShowOneTimePrivacyNotice(Text[250]):Enum::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice Approval State
member.summary: Shows a Privacy Notice for the specified integration name. This call does not require any Privacy Notice to exist, nor will it create one or store the content. This function is purely to show a privacy notice and let the caller handle the consent flow.
member.param: The name of the integration.
member.returns: The state of the privacy notice for the current user.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.ShowOneTimePrivacyNotice(Text[250],Text[2048]):Enum::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice Approval State
member.summary: Shows a Privacy Notice for the specified integration name. This call does not require any Privacy Notice to exist, nor will it create one or store the content. This function is purely to show a privacy notice and let the caller handle the consent flow.

member.summary: Determines whether the admin or user has disagreed with the Privacy Notice.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.CreateDefaultPrivacyNotices
member.summary: Adds all Privacy Notices from extensions using the event OnAddPrivacyNotices.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.OnBeforeShowPrivacyNotice(Privacy Notice,Boolean@)
member.summary: This event is called when we are confirming approval to the privacy notice but no decision has been made. Just before calling any UI to show a dialog to the user. This allows overriding of individual privacy notices in case of custom wizards.

Specifies whether the event has been handled and no further execution should occur.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Privacy#Privacy Notice.OnRegisterPrivacyNotices(Privacy Notice@)
member.summary: This event is called when we are adding all Privacy Notices to the list. This will happen during demotool, upgrade and using the action on the Privacy Notices list. If a Privacy Notice with the same Id already exist, the entry is ignored.
member.param: The privacy notice to be shown.
Specifies whether the event has been handled and no further execution should occur.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Time Zone
member.summary: Codeunit that provides data on offsets and daylight saving time for a time zone.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Time Zone.GetTimezoneOffset(DateTime,Text):Duration
member.summary: Retrieves the offset from the requested time zone at the time of the requested datetime. This takes into account any daylight saving time conditions that may apply.
member.param: The datetime that will be used as the basis for the difference calculation.
The ID of the time zone that you want to calculate the offset for.
member.returns: A duration that indicates the offset between UTC and the requested time zone for the provided datetime.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Time Zone.GetTimezoneOffset(DateTime):Duration
member.summary: Retrieves the offset from the user time zone at the time of the requested datetime. This takes into account any daylight saving time conditions that may apply.
member.param: The datetime that will be used as the basis for the difference calculation.
member.returns: A duration that indicates the offset between UTC and the user time zone for the provided datetime.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Time Zone.GetTimezoneOffset(DateTime,Text,Text):Duration
member.summary: Retrieves the offset of the destination time zone from the source time zone for the indicated datetime. This takes into account any daylight saving time conditions that may apply.
member.param: The datetime that will be used as the basis for the difference calculation.
The time zone from which you want to calculate the difference.
The time zone against which you want to calculate the difference.
member.returns: A duration that indicates the offset between the two time zones at the indicated datetime.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Time Zone.TimeZoneSupportsDaylightSavingTime(Text):Boolean
member.summary: Checks whether the indicated time zone supports daylight saving time.
member.param: The ID of the time zone that you want to check the daylight saving time settings for.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the requested time zone observes daylight saving time.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Time Zone.IsDaylightSavingTime(DateTime,Text):Boolean
member.summary: Checks whether the requested datetime falls within the indicated time zone's daylight saving time period.
member.param: The datetime for which you want to check whether it falls within the time zone's daylight saving time period.
The ID of the time zone against which you want to check the datetime.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the requested datetime falls within the daylight saving time period for the indicated time zone. If the time zone does not observe daylight saving time, this will always return false.

member.name: O:Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Pattern
member.summary: This enum has the occurrence patterns for the recurrence.

member.name: E:Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Pattern.Daily
member.summary: Specifies that the recurrence will occur daily.

member.name: E:Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Pattern.Weekly
member.summary: Specifies that the recurrence will occur weekly.

member.name: E:Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Pattern.Monthly
member.summary: Specifies that the recurrence will occur monthly.

member.name: E:Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Pattern.Yearly
member.summary: Specifies that the recurrence will occur yearly.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule
member.summary: Calculates when the next event will occur. Events can recur daily, weekly, monthly or yearly.

members.member:
Sets the earliest date to be returned from CalculateNextOccurrence. The default MinDateTime is today at the start time set in recurrence.
The minimum datetime. See to calculate next occurrence.
To start calculating recurrence from January 1st, 2000, call SetMinDateTime(CREATEDATETIME(DMY2DATE(1, 1, 2000), 0T)).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CalculateNextOccurrence(Guid,DateTime):DateTime
member.summary: Calculates the time and date for the next occurrence.
member.param: The recurrence ID.
The time of the last scheduled occurrence.
member.returns: Returns the DateTime value for the next occurrence. If there is no next occurrence, it returns the default value 0DT.
member.example: To calculate the first occurrence (this is using the datatime provided in SetMinDateTime as a minimum datetime to return), call CalculateNextOccurrence(RecurrenceID, 0DT)), the RecurrenceID is the ID returned from one of the create functions.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CreateDaily(Time,Date,Date,Integer):Guid
member.summary: Creates a daily recurrence.
member.param: The start time of the recurrence.
The start date of the recurrence.
The end date of the recurrence.
The number of days between each occurrence, starting with 1.
member.returns: The ID used to reference this recurrence.
member.example: To create a recurrence that starts today, repeats every third day, and does not have an end date, call RecurrenceID := CreateDaily(now, today, 0D , 3).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CreateWeekly(Time,Date,Date,Integer,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean):Guid
member.summary: Creates a weekly recurrence.
member.param: The start time of the recurrence.
The start date of the recurrence.
The end date of the recurrence.
The number of weeks between each occurrence, starting with 1.
Occur on Mondays.
Occur on Tuesdays.
Occur on Wednesdays.
Occur on Thursdays.
Occur on Fridays.
Occur on Saturdays.
Occur on Sundays.
member.returns: The ID used to reference this recurrence.
member.example: To create a weekly recurrence that starts today, repeats every Monday and Wednesday, and does not have an end date, call RecurrenceID := CreateWeekly(now, today, 0D , 1, true, false, true, false, false, false, false).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CreateMonthlyByDay(Time,Date,Date,Integer,Integer):Guid
member.summary: Creates a monthly recurrence by day.
member.param: The start time of the recurrence.
The start date of the recurrence.
The end date of the recurrence.
The number of months between each occurrence, starting with 1.
The day of the month.
member.returns: The ID used to reference this recurrence.
member.example: To create a monthly recurrence that repeats on the fourth day of every month, call RecurrenceID := CreateMonthlyByDay(now, today, 0D , 1, 4).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CreateMonthlyByDayOfWeek(Time,Date,Date,Integer,Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Ordinal No#,Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Day of Week):Guid
member.summary: Creates a monthly recurrence by the day of the week.
member.param: The start time of the recurrence.
The start date of the recurrence.
The end date of the recurrence.
The number of months between each occurrence, starting with 1.
The week of the month.
The day of the week.
member.returns: The ID used to reference this recurrence.
member.example: To create a monthly recurrence that calculates every last Friday of every month, call RecurrenceID := CreateMonthlyByDayOfWeek(now, today, 0D , 1, RecurrenceOrdinalNo::Last, RecurrenceDayofWeek::Friday).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CreateYearlyByDay(Time,Date,Date,Integer,Integer,Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Month):Guid
member.summary: Creates a yearly recurrence by day.
member.param: The start time of the recurrence.
The start date of the recurrence.
The end date of the recurrence.
The number of years between each occurrence, starting with 1.
The day of the month.
The month of the year.
member.returns: The ID used to reference this recurrence.
member.example: To create a yearly recurrence that repeats on the first day of December, call RecurrenceID := CreateYearlyByDay(now, today, 0D , 1, 1, RecurrenceMonth::December).

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#DateTime#Recurrence Schedule.CreateYearlyByDayOfWeek(Time,Date,Date,Integer,Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Ordinal No#,Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Day of Week,Enum::System#DateTime#Recurrence - Month):Guid
member.summary: Creates a yearly recurrence by day of week of a given month.
member.param: The start time of the recurrence.
The start date of the recurrence.
The end date of the recurrence.
The number of years between each occurrence, starting with 1.
The week of the month.
The day of the week.
The month of the year.
member.returns: The ID used to reference this recurrence.
member.example: To create a yearly recurrence that repeats on the last Friday of every month, call RecurrenceID := CreateYearlyByDayOfWeek(now, today, 0D , 1, RecurrenceOrdinalNo::Last, RecurrenceDayofWeek::Weekday, RecurrenceMonth::December).

member.example: Account sales@cronus.com has scenarios "Sales Quote" and "Sales Credit Memo" assigned. Account purchase@cronus.com has scenarios "Purchase Quote" and "Purchase Invoice" assigned. member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Reflection#Record Reference

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Reflection#Record Reference.Initialize(RecordRef,Interface::System#Reflection#Record Reference@)
member.summary: Initializes the Record Reference interface. The method raises the OnInitialize event. If no subscriber initializes the interface, a default implementation is assigned.

The interface providing read/write operations.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Reflection#Record Reference.OnInitialize(RecordRef,Interface::System#Reflection#Record Reference@,ModuleInfo,Boolean@)
member.summary: Use this event to initialize the Record Reference interface with an implementation that has the required indirect permissions to read write to the table referenced by the RecordRef parameter.
member.param: The RecordRef parameter points to the table for which the read/write operations are to be handled by the interface.
The interface providing read/write operations.
A ModuleInfo pointing to the app information of the app that called the Initialize method.
Set this to true when the interface is initialized.

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Reflection#Table Key
member.summary: Provides functionality for disabling and re-enabling table indexes.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Reflection#Table Key.DisableAll(Integer):Boolean
member.summary: Disables all keys on the provided table. Disabling keys before bulk table write operations can significantly improve performance.
member.param: The table to disable all of the keys for.
member.returns: True, if the keys were disabled successfully, false otherwise.
member.remarks: System tables and non-sql based tables are not supported for this operation. Clustered keys, unique keys, SIFT keys, Nonclustered Columnstore Indexes are not affected by this operation. The keys are automatically re-enabled when a Commit() is called, or at the end of AL code execution.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Reflection#Table Key.EnableAll(Integer):Boolean
member.summary: Re-enables all keys that have been disabled on the provided table.
member.param: The table to re-enable all of the keys for.
member.returns: True, if the keys were re-enabled successfully, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This method can be used when keys need to be re-enabled (for example, for searching) before a Commit() is called.

member.summary: This permission set allows you to view the language list and set the preferred language for the user

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language
member.summary: Management codeunit that exposes various functions to work with languages.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.GetUserLanguageCode:Code[10]
member.summary: Gets the current user's language code. The function emits the event. To change the language code returned from this function, subscribe for this event and change the passed language code.
member.returns: The language code of the user's language

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.GetLanguageIdOrDefault(Code[10]):Integer
member.summary: Gets the language ID based on its code. Or defaults to the current user language.
member.param: The code of the language
member.returns: The ID for the language code that was provided for this function. If no ID is found for the language code, then it returns the ID of the current user's language.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.GetFormatRegionOrDefault(Text[80]):Text[80]
member.summary: Returns format region for a given language. If format region is provided it itself will be returned. If format region is empty the region is taken from UserSessionSettings. If no valid tag is found, the default 'en-US' tag is returned.
member.param: The variable for the format region id.
member.returns: The ID for the format region that was found.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.GetLanguageId(Code[10]):Integer
member.summary: Gets the language ID based on its code.
member.param: The code of the language
member.returns: The ID for the language code that was provided for this function. If no ID is found for the language code, then it returns 0.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.SetOverrideLanguageId(Integer)
member.summary: Overrides the language ID returned by the GetLanguageIdOrDefault function.
member.param: The ID of the language to use. This must be a valid language ID.
member.remarks: This override will be reset after it's used once in the GetLanguageIdOrDefault function. To keep the override throughout the application, use SetOverrideLanguageId(LanguageId: Integer; ResetOverride: Boolean) method.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.SetOverrideLanguageId(Integer,Boolean)
member.summary: Overrides the language ID returned by the GetLanguageIdOrDefault function.
member.param: The ID of the language to use. This must be a valid language ID.

A boolean value indicating whether the override should be reset after use in the GetLanguageIdOrDefault function. If set to true, the override is reset after it's used once. If set to false, the override remains until it's manually reset or the session is restarted.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.SetOverrideFormatRegion(Text[80])
member.summary: Overrides the format region returned by the GetFormatRegionOrDefault function.
member.param: The region to use for formatting purposes. This must be a valid region code.
member.remarks: This override will be reset after it's used once in the GetFormatRegionOrDefault function. To keep the override throughout the session, use SetOverrideFormatRegion(FormatRegion: Text[80]; ResetOverride: Boolean) method.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Globalization#Language.SetOverrideFormatRegion(Text[80],Boolean)
member.summary: Overrides the format region returned by the GetFormatRegionOrDefault function.
member.param: The region to use for formatting purposes. This must be a valid region code.

A boolean value indicating whether the override should be reset after use in the GetFormatRegionOrDefault function. If set to true, the override is reset after it's used once. If set to false, the override remains until it's manually reset or the session is restarted.

member.summary: Gets the value of a field in the global language for the record.
member.param: The record to get the translated value for.
The ID of the field for which the translation is stored.
member.returns: The translated value.
member.error: If the RecVariant parameter is the type Record, and it is temporary.
If the RecVariant parameter is the type Record, and the table number is 0.
member.example: To get the value of the description field for an item record, call GetValue(Item, Item.FIELDNO(Description)).
member.remarks: If a translated record for the global language cannot be found it finds the Windows language translation. If a Windows language translation cannot be found, return an empty string.

member.returns: The translated value.
member.error: If the RecVariant parameter is the type Record, and it is temporary.
If the RecVariant parameter is the type Record, and the table number is 0.
member.example: To get the value of the Description field for an item record in Danish, call GetValue(Item, Item.FIELDNO(Description), 1030).

member.name: O:Table::System#Tooling#SmartList Designer Handler
member.summary: A single-record table that can be used to handle contention between multiple subscribers of the events for the SmartList Designer. Consumers of the events should check this record to see if another extension is registered as the handler and then decide if they should execute code within their own subscriptions to these events. Likewise, consumers could set this record to register themselves as the handler of events.

member.name: F:Table::System#Tooling#SmartList Designer Handler.PrimaryKey[10]
member.summary: The primary key of the table. As a single-record table this value should only ever be set to the empty string ''.

member.name: F:Table::System#Tooling#SmartList Designer Handler.HandlerExtensionId
member.summary: The AppId of the extension that has registered itself as the handler of SmartList Designer events.

member.name: E:Enum::System#Telemetry#Feature Uptake Status.Discovered
member.summary: The feature has been discovered.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#Telemetry#Feature Uptake Status Impl#.WaitForStartedUpdateFeatureUptakeSession
member.summary: The updates to Feature Uptake states must be done in a separate session (e. g. to not interfere with subsequent Page.RunModal() calls). Normally we don't need to wait for this separate session to finish, as feature uptake states are expected to not change rapidly, and it only takes a few milliseconds for the session to complete. But if the feature registers uptake states one right after another, then the session may not have enough time to start and acquire a lock on the "Feature Uptake" table by the time the next uptake state is registered. For such cases, we can wait for this previous session to finish.
member.remarks: We will only ever wait when feature uptake states a registered for the first time, so there is no persistent performance penalty to this.
It is not hard requirement to actually wait for the session to finish, we only need to wait long enough, so that it calls FeatureUptake.LockTable().

member.name: O:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params
member.summary: Represents the Chat Completion parameters used by the API. See more details at https://aka.ms/AAlrz36.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.GetTemperature:Decimal
member.summary: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
member.returns: The sampling temperature being used.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.GetMaxTokens:Integer
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer.
member.returns: The maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer.
member.remarks: 0 or less uses the API default.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.GetMaxHistory:Integer
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of messages to send back as the message history.
member.returns: The maximum number of messages to send.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.GetPresencePenalty:Decimal
member.summary: Gets the presence penalty value.
member.returns: The presence penalty value.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.GetFrequencyPenalty:Decimal
member.summary: Gets the frequency penalty value.
member.returns: The frequency penalty value.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.SetTemperature(Decimal)
member.summary: Sets the sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. A higher temperature increases the likelihood that the next most probable token will not be selected. When requesting structured data, set the temperature to 0. For human sounding speech, 0.7 is a typical value
member.param: The new sampling temperature to use.
member.error: Temperature must be between 0.0 and 2.0.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.SetMaxTokens(Integer)
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. The maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. By default, the number of tokens the model can return will be (4096 - prompt tokens).
member.param: The new maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer.
member.remarks: If the prompt's tokens + max_tokens exceeds the model's context length, the generate request will return an error.
0 or less uses the API default.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.SetJsonMode(Boolean)
member.summary: Sets if the model should return a valid JSON object as a chat completion.
member.param: The new Json mode for the chat completion: true or false.
member.remarks: Default is false.
When true, the model will return a valid JSON object as a chat completion. Including guidance to the model that it should produce JSON as part of the messages conversation is required
When true, the word 'json' must be included in at least one message.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.SetMaxHistory(Integer)
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of messages to send back as the message history.
member.param: The new maximum number of messages to send.
member.error: Max history cannot be less than 1.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Chat Completion Params.SetFrequencyPenalty(Decimal)

member.param: The new frequency penalty value.
member.error: Frequency penalty must be between -2.0 and 2.0.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.SetMaxTokens(Integer)
member.summary: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. The token count of your prompt plus max_tokens can't exceed the model's context length. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 4096).
member.param: The new maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.
member.remarks: If the prompt's tokens + max_tokens exceeds the model's context length, the generate request will return an error.
The default value is 256 however a value of 0 or less will use the deployment model's default.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.SetTemperature(Decimal)
member.summary: Sets the sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. A higher temperature increases the likelihood that the next most probable token will not be selected. When requesting structured data, set the temperature to 0. For human sounding speech, 0.7 is a typical value
member.param: The new sampling temperature to use.
member.error: Temperature must be between 0.0 and 2.0

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.SetTopP(Decimal)
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.
member.param: New nucleus sampling to use

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.SetSuffix(Text)
member.summary: The suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text.
member.param: The new suffix that comes after a completion of inserted text.

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.SetPresencePenalty(Decimal)
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.
member.param: The new presence penalty to use.
member.error: Presence penalty must be between -2.0 and 2.0

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.SetFrequencyPenalty(Decimal)
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
member.param: The new frequency penalty to use.
member.error: Frequency penalty must be between -2.0 and 2.0

member.name: M:Codeunit::System#AI#AOAI Text Completion Params.AddCompletionsParametersToPayload(JsonObject@)
member.summary: Add the completion parameters to the payload.
member.param: The JsonObject payload to add the completion parameters to.

member.name: M:Interface::System#AI#AOAI Function.GetPrompt:JsonObject
member.summary: Get the prompt for the Function. Function prompt object describes the Function and the should contain the following fields: - Type: The name of the Function, currently only function type is supported. For functions following fields are allowed: -- Name: The name of the Function. (Required) -- Description: The description of the Function. (Optional) -- Parameters: The parameters of the Function. (Required) More details can be found here: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2254538

member.summary: Get the name of the function.
member.remarks: This needs to match the function name in GetPrompt.
